page.title: 08Sydenhams and Piedmont.
page.content:
Sydenhams used to be a large estate in the 18th century.It is now divided into arable land and pasture .The farmland is on a relatively flat plain,but it gives way to a deep green valley wooded with ash,beech and conifers.
At the bottom of the valley is a small stream flowing over a grassy plain. This bends with the valley in a right angle,and scattered on the South -facing side,at Piedmont,are a few cottages,used mainly at weekends by people working and living in London.
We live near Sydenhams,overlooking the valley.There is no through road here so it is very quiet,except for the occasional group of motorcyclists who scramble in the woods. Sometimes a string of ponies (continued on page 9)
